main.name: Will Cooper
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I'm from Cambridge, MA. I love coding and playing around with data. I also love piano, singing, ice hockey, tennis, and spontaneity.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to send a message! About anything!

resume.skillmessage: Some things I can do, among others:

education.degree: A.B. in Applied Math and Computer Science (in progress)
education.description: Relevant classes include: CS50, System Programming and Machine Organization, Data Structures and Algorithms, Multivariable Calculus, Linear Algebra and Differential Equations, Web Programming in Python and Javascript. At Harvard I am the co-director of education for Harvard computer Society, I play club hockey and club tennis, sing in the Memorial Church Choir, and volunteer at the nearby soup kitchen, HSHS (Harvard Square Homeless Shelters).
Played hockey and tennis (varsity captain), Aerospace engineering club, president of Asian club

work.title: Data Science Intern
work.description: Responsible for manipulation of large bank transaction datasets for machine learning purposes. Make use of natural language processing, pandas (dataframes), and matplotlib (Python plotting)

work.title: Astrophysics Intern
work.description: Developed open source code for simulation of celestial n-body problems, focusing specifially on Alpha Centauri. Created Python classes to generate, statistically analyze, plot and animate data produced from simulations

work.company: Harvard Initiative for the Science of the Human Past
work.title: Web Developler Intern
work.description: Revamped the study's website, added functionality and increased performance. Created interactive maps using Javascript (Arcgis JS)

skills.name: But having a good time all around

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
